channel.title: Portable Steam.
channel.description: Has anyone got a clue if a working one exists? Because I want to access the chat and can't even run the damn thing on work.

item.title: Portable Steam.
item.dc:creator: Charli
item.description:
It would be great if the Steam Friends protocol could be integrated into some multi platform messengers like Miranda or Pidgin but that’s sadly not possible yet…

if someone’s further I interested in how the Protocol works and why it’s not possible yet have look at this wiki

item.title: Portable Steam.
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
You can just copy steam on your usb key and run steam.exe on any PC you want.

Steam doesn’t store account information in the registry, just make sure to never set it to autostart on startup, or you would get an error after removing the usb drive.

If you’re gonna run a virtual machine like level, I recommend Sun Virtualbox, it’s fast and supports many features. (although VmWare has better graphics support IMO)

See, the problem is I’m on job now and sitting the whole night here. I needed to know if I can find a quick solution to launch steam on the comp on my job.
Looks like I’m going to have a lonely night xD

Read full topic

item.title: Portable Steam.

You can just copy steam on your usb key and run steam.exe on any PC you want.

Steam doesn’t store account information in the registry, just make sure to never set it to autostart on startup, or you would get an error after removing the usb drive.

If you’re gonna run a virtual machine like level, I recommend Sun Virtualbox, it’s fast and supports many features. (although VmWare has better graphics support IMO)

item.title: Portable Steam.
item.dc:creator: Level
item.description:
I know of a way to make any program a ‘portable’ version. Don’t know if you’d be able to play games on it, but the idea behind it is that you can set up individual programs to run inside a virtual machine.

I have a video, but it’s like 200 mb in high res. I’ll see if I can megaupload you a copy.

edit
Lost the video, but if you have a demonoid account I can forward you the link. PM me whether you have an account or not, because I can get you one.
